definition:
&%EFScaleAttribute is short for the Enhanced 
Fujita Scale. It is the &%Attribute for indicating the intensity of a &%Tornado according to a 
set of 3-second gusts wind estimates based on damage it caused. The lightest tornados(EFO) 
have wind gusts ranging between 65 to 85 mph,and the severest &%Tornades (EF5) 
&%GreaterThan 200 mph.
opposite_reasoning: EFScaleAttribute measures extreme atmospheric violence and wind intensity. CalmState represents the most natural meteorological opposite - the absence of atmospheric disturbance. This provides strong opposition strength (8/10) within the same semantic domain (weather/atmospheric conditions). While not directly relevant to deception detection, it creates a clear attribute spectrum from violent to calm. CalmState is likely to exist in SUMO as a common weather-related state concept. If unavailable, WeakAttribute provides a good fallback as a general intensity opposite.
